resources.string: Home Sync Wizard helps you share files between your %s and other devices.
Select a device you want to connect with your phone:
Select what you would like to do with your %s and %s:
Select how you would like to copy files:
You can use %s to copy photos, videos and music from your %s to other %s devices.
Ensure that your %s\'s Bluetooth setting is turned on.
Check to make sure Bluetooth Discovery is enabled on your %s.
Select a file to copy to your %s via Bluetooth.
Select your %s from the Bluetooth list. The file you selected will be sent to your %s.
You can use DLNA to play your photos, videos and music on other devices in your home wireless network.
Check to make sure your %s supports DLNA.
For more info on DLNA, check
Connect your %s and your %s to your home wireless network.

Using Media Share on your %s, select \"Play media\", then choose the file you wish to play. Select \"Playback device\" from the menu and choose your %s from the list of devices. Your media will now be played on your %s.
Using Media Share on your %s, press and hold on the file you wish to play.
Select \"Play on remote device\" from the menu that appears.
Choose your %s from the list of devices. Your file will now be played on your %s.
You can use DLNA to allow your %s to access photos, videos and music on your %s.
Enable the \"Share media\" option on your %s.
Open DLNA on your %s and select your %s in the DLNA server list . You can now select a file to share with your %s.
Use the %s to browse content that is saved on your %s.
You can use Windows Folder Sharing to copy or move files between your %s and a %s on your home wireless network.
Enable Windows Folder Sharing on your %s.
Connect your %s and your %s to your home wireless network.
Using Connected File Manager on your %s, select the file or folder you want to copy.
Using Connected File Manager on your %s, select where you want to copy your file. Once you select a folder, your file will be copied to this location.
You can copy files between your %s\'s memory card and your %s using a USB cable.
Connect your %s to your %s with a USB cable.
On your %s, change the USB mode to Mass Storage.
Ensure that your %s\'s USB mode is set to USB Mass Storage.
Open the file manager on your %s. You will see your %s as a removable disk.
Drag and drop content onto the removable disk to copy it to your %s\'s memory card.
You can use DLNA to copy media files between your %s and other devices in you home wireless network.
Select how you\'d like to copy media files.
Using Media Share on your %s, press and hold on the file you wish to upload and select \"Upload\" from the menu. Select a server from the list. Your file will be uploaded to the server.
Using Media Share on your %s, press and hold on the file you wish to upload.
Select \"Upload\" from the menu that appears.
Choose your %s from the list of devices. Your file will now be uploaded to your %s.

Using Media Share on your %s, select a server in the device list. Press and hold on the file you wish to download and select \"Download\" from the menu that appears. Your file will be downloaded to your /download folder and will appear in your media library.
Using Media Share on your %s, choose your %s from the list of devices.
Press and hold on the file you wish to download.
Select \"Download\" from the menu that appears. Your file will be downloaded to your /download folder and will appear in your media library.
You can sync files between your %s and Windows Media Player using a USB cable.
Connect your %s to your computer with a USB cable.
Ensure that your %s\'s USB mode is set to Windows Media Sync.
Open Windows Media Player on your computer. You should see your %s in the device list.
Drag and drop files onto your %s to sync.
Copy or move files between devices
Play your photos, videos and music on other devices
Allow other devices to access your photos, videos and music
Transfer files directly between devices. Bluetooth is currently turned %s.
Share and play media files between devices on a Wi-Fi network. Wi-Fi is currently turned %s.
Access files on your Windows computer or network drives. Windows Folder Sharing is currently turned %s.
Browse files on your memory card using your computer. USB Mass Storage is currently turned %s.
Please press Enable Bluetooth button in this screen to turn on Bluetooth and pair device.
Please press Wi-Fi settings button in this screen to turn on Wi-Fi and connected with network.
Please select a file to send via Bluetooth.
There is no SD card. Local content will not be accessible. Please insert SD card and relaunch application.
Notify me when a connection is available
Allow other devices to access media files on phone
The memory card is missing. Insert a memory card to access Media Share.
A Wi-Fi network must be connected to continue.
Bluetooth must be turned on to continue.
USB Mass Storage mode must be turned on to continue.
USB Mass Storage mode must be turned on to continue.
Windows Media Sync mode must be turned on to continue.
The USB connection can not change to
The hostname you typed is not valid.
You must complete the port field.
The port field must be empty if the host field is empty.
The port you typed is not valid.
Manage Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, airplane mode, mobile networks, & VPNs
Connect to data services when roaming
Connect to data services when roaming
You have lost data connectivity because you left your home network with data roaming turned off.
Allow data roaming? You may incur significant roaming charges!
Set up & manage wireless access points
Push the connection button on the access point.
Enter this PIN code in the Wi-Fi access point:\n

Push the connection button on the access point.

Or, enter the following PIN code into the Wi-Fi access point:
For security reasons, this Wi-Fi access point will connect using a PIN code.
The wps pin you typed is not correct. Please try again.
WPS method fails. Please try again.
WPS method timeout. Please try again.
WPS PBC session overlap. Please wait a while, or try connect it using a PIN code.
Unable to connect to the network
Connection unsuccessful, touch to try again
Notify me when an open network is available
The network password you typed is not correct. Please try again.
There is a problem connecting to the network. Please try again.
Please type a valid IP address.
Use default IP settings if Auto configuration (DHCP) fails
Set the number of channels to use
There was a problem setting the regulatory domain.
Specify when to switch from Wi-Fi to mobile data
There was a problem setting the sleep policy.
Set up voicemail, call forwarding, call waiting, caller ID
Set options for roaming, networks, APNs
See location in applications (such as Maps) using wireless networks
Location determined by Wi-Fi and/or mobile networks
When locating, accurate to street level (uncheck to conserve battery)
Locate to street-level (requires more battery plus view of sky)
Use server to assist GPS (uncheck to reduce network usage)
Use server to assist GPS (uncheck to improve GPS performance)
Use My Location for Google search results and other Google services
Do you want to allow Google to use location for improved search results and other services?
You have selected a Wi-Fi network that is password protected. You will need to enter a password in order to have access to this network.
If you don\'t see your Wi-Fi network in the list, you can add it manually. You will need to enter some information about the network in order to connect.
Wi-Fi is currently turned off. You will need to turn on Wi-Fi before you continue.
Now that Wi-Fi is on, you can see a list of Wi-Fi network that are available. You will need to choose one of these networks to continue.
Wi-Fi is currently on, but you are not connected to a network. You will need to choose a network to continue.
Connecting to a Wi-Fi network is easy. Select the checkbox to turn on Wi-Fi here. (You can also turn on Wi-Fi in settings).
You are now connected to %s network.
Wi-Fi is currently turned on and you are connected to %s network.
You are exiting the Media Share app. Once you have updated your Wi-Fi settings, you will need to restart the Media Share app to continue.
No networks were detected, but you may be able to connect to your network manually. Select \"Find other network\" and then enter your network\'s information manually.
On the remote %s, enable the media player to accept playback requests from this phone.
Your files will now be copied.
Your files will now be synced.
Media Share helps you share files between your phone and other devices.
Enable the remote %s to accept file uploads from this phone.
• Play a video from your phone on your TV
• Copy a picture from one phone to another
